thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Friday, 02 Mar 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: CORRECTED-Brazil fintech Nubank raises $150 million in financing round

author: Reuters Editorial
title: CORRECTED-Brazil fintech Nubank raises $150 million in financing round
text:
(Corrects second paragraph to show Dragoneer Investment Group LLC is an investment firm, not a venture capital firm)
SAO PAULO, March 1 (Reuters) - Brazilian financial startup Nubank said on Thursday it raised $150 million in a new financing round led by venture capital firm DST Global Investment Partners, alongside other current investors, such as Founders Fund, Redpoint Ventures, Ribbit Capital LP and QED.
Two new firms also joined Nubank in its sixth round, investment firm Dragoneer Investment Group LLC and venture capital firm Thrive Capital Partners Inc. Since its foundation in 2013, Nubank has raised $330 million.
Nubank founder, David Vélez, said in a statement the startup will use the proceeds to leverage its growth. The São Paulo-based startup received regulatory approval to become a bank in January. (Reporting by Alberto Alerigi Jr. and Carolina Mandl; editing by Diane Craft)
